definition: to give an orderly account/a thorough narrative
to spread/to lay out/to apply (powder, ointment etc)/sufficient (to cover)/enough
surname Chen/Chen (c. 1045 - 479 BC), a Zhou dynasty state/Chen (557-589), one of the Southern Dynasties 南朝[Nan2 Chao2]
to lay out/to exhibit/to display/to narrate/to state/to explain/to tell/old/stale

sentences.english: The mtowardster wto function as then reported to every student by telephone.
sentences.chinese: 这件事自后用电话敷陈给每个学生。

sentences.english: The doctor's report removed all their anxieties.
sentences.chinese: 医生的敷陈消除了他们的一切焦灼。

sentences.english: Can you tell me the time ?
Boy: I"d like to call you. Your number?"
sentences.chinese: 能敷陈我你的电话号码吗？

sentences.english: She forgot telling mother about it.
sentences.chinese: 她忘了曾敷陈过母亲这件事。

sentences.english: Many of London's streets help narrate British history.
sentences.chinese: 许多伦敦的街道都在敷陈着大不列颠的历史。

sentences.english: She told me she wanted to start a company.
